result.execSummary:
The defendant Mario Mose Jones Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Mario Mose Jones Jr is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Mario Mose Jones Jr was found guilty of Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank. On motion of defense counsel, Court WAIVES DNA SURCHARGE. Pay all applicable court costs and surcharges. As to costs and surcharges, DOC shall collect up to 25% of prison funds. Remaining balance to be collected during the period of ES. Any unpaid amount to be converted to a civil judgment.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he/she may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

records.addlTxt: - denying motion to vacate the DNA surcharge, signed and filed.
Transcript ADJOURNMENT, commencing JULY 13, 2015, received and filed.  Original transcript in case file 14CF2995 (4 Pages).
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Frederick C. Rosa, Br. 35, for review. jbs
Defendant's pro se motion to delete the DNA surcharge received in cases 14CF002995 and 15CF000646.  Filed in 14CF002995.
Original Transcript (24 pages) commencing 10-19-2015 SCHEDULED JURY TRIAL/PLEA AND SENTENCING received and filed.

Defendant Mario Mose Jones in court with attorney Mark Stuart Tishberg.  Defendant Mario Mose Jones in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY as to COUNT 1. On motion of the State, Court orders COUNT 2 dismissed.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms or body armor. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 
Statements made as to sentencing.  
AS TO COUNT 1: The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  5 YEARS and 6 MONTHS CONSECUTIVE TO ANY OTHER SENTENCE, with credit for 257 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS AND 6 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS.  The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the "Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program".
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank. On motion of defense counsel, Court WAIVES DNA SURCHARGE. 
Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges. 
As to all costs and surcharges, DOC shall collect up to 25% of prison funds. Reminaing balance to be collected during the period of extended supervision. Any unpaid amount to be converted to a civil judgement. 
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he/she may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. 

Filed,
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Defendant Mario Mose Jones in court with attorney Mark Stuart Tishberg.  Defendant Mario Mose Jones in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 7.   All parties notified as of August 03, 2015 this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35, in room 629 of the courthouse.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 10-19-2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Mark S. Tishberg in court, defendant Mario Mose Jones not in court, in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 7.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 07-13-2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Mark S. Tishberg in court, defendant Mario Mose Jones not in court, in custody.  Hanna Kolberg for Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Attorney Mark S. Tishberg in court, defendant Mario Mose Jones not in court, in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court ordered case adjourned for bail/bond hearing in Branch 7.  Status conference scheduled for 05-04-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Mario Mose Jones in court with attorney Mark S. Tishberg.  Defendant Mario Mose Jones in custody.  Joy Hammond for Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Thomas McAdams, Branch 07.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 07.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION and Electronic Monitoring.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription. No possession of dangerous weapons, firearms, ammunition, holsters, or body armor. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Mario Mose Jones in court with attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  Defendant Mario Mose Jones in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge McAdams, Branch 7.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
